org.apache.plc4x.java.opm

Class PlcEntityManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.plc4x.java.opm.PlcEntityManager

  • public class PlcEntityManager
extends Object
    Plc4x equivalent of Jpas EntityManager for implementing Object-Plc-Mapping. This means that calls to a plc can be done by using plain POJOs with Annotations.

    First, the necessary annotations are PlcEntity and PlcField. For a class to be usable as PlcEntity it needs

    • be non-final (as proxiing has to be used in case of connect(Class, String)
    • a public no args constructor for instanciation
    • Needs to be annotated with PlcEntity and has a valid value which is the connection string

    Basically, the PlcEntityManager has to operation "modes" represented by the methods read(Class,String) and connect(Class,String).

    For a field to get Values from the Plc Injected it needs to be annotated with the PlcField annotation. The value has to be the plc fields string (which is inserted in the PlcReadRequest). The connection string is taken from the value of the PlcEntity annotation on the class.

    The read(Class,String) method has no direkt equivalent in JPA (as far as I know) as it only returns a "detached" entity. This means it fetches all values from the plc that are annotated wiht the PlcField annotations.

    The connect(Class,String) method is more JPA-like as it returns a "connected" entity. This means, that each time one of the getters on the returned entity is called a call is made to the plc (and the field value is changed for this specific field). Furthermore, if a method which is no getter is called, then all PlcFields are refreshed before doing the call. Thus, all operations on fields that are annotated with PlcField are always done against the "live" values from the PLC.

    A connected @PlcEntity can be disconnected calling disconnect(Object), then it behaves like the regular Pojo it was before.

    All invocations on the getters are forwarded to the PlcEntityInterceptor.intercept(Object, Method, Callable, String, PlcDriverManager, AliasRegistry, Map) method.
